document.masterDocTitle: Taxonomic notes on Exetastes fukuchiyamanus Uchida, 1928 (Hymenoptera, Ichneumonidae, Banchinae), with description of a new species from Japan and China

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Taxonomic notes on Exetastes fukuchiyamanus Uchida, 1928 (Hymenoptera, Ichneumonidae, Banchinae), with description of a new species from Japan and China

bibRefCitation.refString: Uchida, T. (1928) Dritter Beitrag zur Ichneumoniden-Fauna Japans. Journal of the Faculty of Agriculture, Hokkaido University, 25, 1 - 115.

subSubSection.paragraph: Mesosoma covered with dense punctures and dark brown setae. Epomia absent. Pleural carina of propodeum entirely strong. Propodeum covered with irregular rugae, with a pair of longitudinal ridges medially, with a pair of sublateral convexities. Fore wing length 10.0– 11.5 mm . Vein 1m-cu with a ramulus. Areolet large, receiving vein 2m-cu at middle. Vein Rs strongly sinuate basally. Hind femur 6.4–6.9 × as long as maximum depth in lateral view. Longest spur of hind tibia shorter than half length of first tarsomere. Hind first tarsomere 2.2–2.3 × as long as second tarsomere. Tarsal claws pectinate.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 14–18.
Exetastes
fukuchiyamanus Uchida
, 1928
, female (14–16) and male (17, 18)—14, 17, lateral habitus; 15, 18, head, frontal view; 16, T2, dorsal view.

Distribution . Japan (Honshu, Shikoku and Kyushu), China ( Hubei and Liaoning ), and Far East Russia .
Bionomics . The host is unknown. All adult wasps collected in autumn.
Remarks . The above distribution record from Russia is based on Kuslitzky (2007) .
